protocol_name: Selective protection and labelling of arginine/lysine side chains in HBSs of proteins
protocol_name_html: Selective protection and labelling of arginine/lysine side chains in HBSs of proteins
description: Interactions between heparan sulfate proteoglycans and the partner proteins regulate many aspects of cell functions, however, their binding properties are still equivocal. Developed eight years ago was a method for selective labelling of lysine residues in the heparin binding sites of Fibroblast Growth Factors (FGFs). The labelling of arginine residues is far more challenging, due to the multiple reaction products between a dicarbonyl and a guanidino group.
status_info: We are still developing and optimizing this protocol

steps.data:
{"blocks":[{"key":"5ppak","text":"AF-heparin beads (Tosoh Biosciences GmbH, Stuttgart, Germany; binding capacity of 4 mg antithrombin III\/mL) used in the lysine selective labelling protocol [9] were used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ehhg9","text":"A mini affinity column was made by placing a plastic air filter as a frit at the end of a P10 pipette tip (Star Lab Ltd., Milton Keynes, UK) and then packed with 20 \u03bcL AF-heparin beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3a17i","text":"The mini-column was equilibrated with 4 \u00d7 50 \u03bcL 200 mM NaCl, 0.2M NaHCO3, pH 9.5\u00a0 (Na-1 buffer).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":71,"length":3,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6i8fq","text":"The buffer was dispensed slowly into the column using a 2 mL sterile syringe.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9bbeb","text":"A minimum of 10 \u03bcg FGF protein was loaded onto the column (generally, the loading capacity of FGFs to resin was estimated at 15 mg\/mL).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5b1ln","text":"The loading was repeated 3 times to ensure the binding between protein and heparin beads. After binding, the column was washed with 200 \u03bcL (4 x 50 \u03bcL) Na-1 buffer to remove any unbound protein.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4l8k3","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"cb19f","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"c0p3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":2}],"data":[]},{"key":"bb5cs","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":3}],"data":[]},{"key":"20kdp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":4}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"7865","amount":"20","unit":"1","label":"AF-heparin beads","guid":"2C2D1E96350749D7AF365E125B1D0331"}},{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"7866","amount":"10","unit":"1","label":"protein","guid":"B2663A48263F471FB0BE11693E024B6D"}},{"type":"notes","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":"

The concentration of NaCl in Na-1 Buffer could be modified, depending on the affinity of protein to heparin<\/p>"},{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"297","concentration":"0.2","unit":"21","label":"NaHCO3","guid":"6E041086952349F284274D2AB36171EE"}},{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":127134,"guid":"","linfor":null,"mol_weight":0,"name":"TOYOPEARL AF-Heparin HC-650M","_public":"","reagent_vendor_link":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io","sku":"0020030","url":"https:\/\/www.separations.eu.tosohbioscience.com\/solutions\/process-media-products\/by-mode\/affinity\/toyopearl-af-heparin-hc-650m","vendor":{"name":"Contributed by users","affiliation":null,"username":null,"link":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io","image":{"source":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/img\/vendors\/1.png","placeholder":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/img\/vendors\/1.png"},"badges":[],"research_interests":null,"id":1},"public":0,"can_edit":0,"stats":{"total_protocols":0}}}],"guid":"A67522FA77AC4780BA98D8A4E5427026","id":642915,"previous_id":null,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Binding"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b4nkt","text":"PGO (Merck Ltd., UK, 97%) was used in the dark, as it is light sensitive. PGO was freshly prepared in 50% (v\/v) DMSO, 50% (v\/v) HPLC grade water at 1 M, which was then diluted to 0.5 M and then 0.2 M with 0.2 M NaHCO3, pH 9.5.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":216,"length":3,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4ca8t","text":"The pH was adjusted by 0.1 M NaOH to between 9.1 and 9.5 to ensure optimal reaction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5j44h","text":"The heparin mini column was rinsed with 30 \u03bcL of the 0.2 M PGO solution to exchange buffers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ja5f","text":"A further 30 \u00b5L PGO solution was added to the column and the bound protein was allowed to react for 60 min at room temperature in the dark.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7rgoe","text":"The reaction was quenched with 5 \u03bcL 0.1% (v\/v) Trifluoroacetic acid (TFA) in water so that the final concentration of TFA is 0.01% (v\/v).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"43c3i","text":"The mini-column was then washed with 200 \u03bcL Na-1 buffer (4 x 50 \u03bcL). Bound proteins were eluted with 2 x 20 \u03bcL Na-2 buffer (2 M NaCl, 0.2M NaHCO3,\u00a0 pH 9.5) containing 0.1% (w\/v) RapiGest SF Surfactant (Waters, UK).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":144,"length":4,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"30nrb","text":"The addition of surfactant was important to ensure protein recovery in this and subsequent steps, due to the increased hydrophobicity of the protein following PGO conjugation to arginine side chains.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4nddk","text":" {"blocks":[{"key":"cu7dl","text":"The preparation of HPG was performed in the dark room as it is even more light-sensitive than PGO, following a procedure identical to that used for PGO.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fp8hd","text":"The eluted protein was diluted with 400 \u03bcL 0.2M NaHCO3, pH 9.5 and concentrated on a 3.5 kDa MWCO centrifugal filter to a final volume of 90~100 \u03bcL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":53,"length":3,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8tadj","text":"The reaction with HPG was performed by incubating 80 \u03bcL diluted protein with 20 \u03bcL 0.5M HPG so that the final concentration of HPG in the reaction was 0.1 M.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7s6aj","text":"The pH was maintained at over 9.0. The reaction was performed for 60 min at room temperature in the dark and then was quenched with 5 \u03bcL 0.1% (v\/v) TFA in water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dllvu","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"661td","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"aoigg","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":2}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"16968","duration":"3600","label":"React in the dark","guid":"404DFB118CFA435F9DD3F9B0970A3490"}},{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"299","concentration":"0.1","unit":"21","label":"HPG","guid":"B7971015E6BB48BB96CF8158FC8149A0"}},{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":127137,"guid":"","linfor":"C8H6O3","mol_weight":168.15,"name":"(P-Hydroxyphenyl)Glyoxal","_public":"","reagent_vendor_link":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io","sku":"24645-80-5","url":"http:\/\/www.proteochem.com\/hpg1gram-p-65.html","vendor":{"name":"Contributed by users","affiliation":null,"username":null,"link":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io","image":{"source":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/img\/vendors\/1.png","placeholder":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/img\/vendors\/1.png"},"badges":[],"research_interests":null,"id":1},"public":0,"can_edit":0,"stats":{"total_protocols":0}}}],"guid":"501A0CDD7E244BAA817C368C0037AA3F","id":642917,"previous_id":642916,"previous_guid":"84B655D3245F49E0AD195D8CA6784391","section":"Labelling of Arginine side chain by HPG"}

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"37cag","text":"For labeling, protein was buffer exchanged by four cycles of dilution on 3.5 kDa-MWCO centrifugal filters with 400 \u03bcL 10-fold diluted 0.2 M NaHCO3, pH 9.5 containing 0.1% (w\/v) RapiGest and 3 cycles of dilution with 400 \u03bcL HPLC water containing 0.1% (w\/v) RapiGest by centrifugation at 13200 rpm for 10 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":145,"length":3,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dujp8","text":"After freezing at -80\u00b0C for 30 min, the sample was lyophilized for an hour.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a818f","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"equipment","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"74","guid":"7CBD58D1AEC44103B55DF92DCB02FE41","brand":"merckmillipore","sku":"UFC500396","specifications":"3.5 kDa-MWCO centrifugal filters","file_id":null,"file_icon":"https:\/\/stage.protocols.io\/img\/extensions\/png.png","image_id":null,"s3_image_name":"https:\/\/s3.amazonaws.com\/pr-journal\/xszf5h6.png","s3_file_name":"https:\/\/s3.amazonaws.com\/pr-journal\/xsyf5h6.png","file_name":"equipment green icon.png","image_name":"equipment icon.png","can_edit":true,"name":null,"type":null,"link":null}}],"guid":"F4443B18AB494FBFA2C0AEEF67473160","id":642918,"previous_id":642917,"previous_guid":"501A0CDD7E244BAA817C368C0037AA3F","section":"Sample preparation for Mass Spectrometry"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"94f84","text":"The freeze-dried protein was dissolved in a mixture of 80 \u03bcL 25 mM NH4HCO3 and 10 \u03bcL 1% (w\/v) RapiGest (~0.1% w\/v in final solution) and heated at 80\u00b0C for 10 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":69,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":73,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f48lg","text":"The mixture was quickly centrifuged at 3200 rpm for 30 seconds before 5 \u03bcL 50 mM DTT was added (5mM final concentration) and incubated for 15 min at 56\u00b0C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1f5mt","text":"After cooling the sample to room temperature, proteins were carbamidomethylated with 5 \u03bcL 0.1M iodoacetamide (freshly made) for 30 min in the dark.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3qa7u","text":"Proteins were then digested overnight with chymotrypsin (Promega Ltd., UK) at a ratio of 1:100.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5sha4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"ah1q","text":" Sequencing Grade, dark","guid":"32377EC9061E4553AFA9288A06E6A0B1"}}],"guid":"26B607BAADAF4368A72ABA2D3987B025","id":642919,"previous_id":642918,"previous_guid":"F4443B18AB494FBFA2C0AEEF67473160","section":"Incubation with Chymotrypsin\/Trypsin"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ctcis","text":"Peptides were concentrated by rotary evaporation to a final volume of 10 \u03bcL and desalted using C18 Zip-Tips(Millipore). C18 Zip Tips were first pre-wetted with 2 x 10 \u03bcL 100 % (v\/v) acetonitrile and then pre-equilibrated with 2 x 10 \u03bcL 0.1% (w\/v) TFA in water. The peptides were loaded on the Zip Tip, the loading was repeated 7 to 8 times to ensure binding. The Zip Tip was washed with 10 \u03bcL 0.1% (w\/v) TFA. Finally, the peptides were eluted with 2 \u03bcL of 5mg\/mL \u03b1-cyano-4-hydroxycinnamic acid (CHCA, > 99% purity, Sigma) in 50:50 acetonitrile\/water + 1%TFA, straight onto a 96 spot MALDI (matrix-assisted laser desorption\/ionisation) target plate. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3qjgb","text":"Analyses were performed on the instrument Synapt G2-Si (Waters, Manchester, UK) with MALDI source equipped with a frequency tripled Nd:YAG UV laser (\u03bb = 355 nm), operating at 1 kHz. The spectrum acquisition time was 120 seconds, with 1 second scan rates, laser energy of 150 Au. The MS spectra were extracted by MASSLYNX v.4.1 (Waters, Manchester, UK) with the spectrum range from 500 Da to 4000 Da. The spectra were then processed using automatic peak detection including background subtraction.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"F73F85B0CC7711E8A0A2ABC93CC6701D","id":673033,"previous_guid":"26B607BAADAF4368A72ABA2D3987B025","section":"Mass spectrometry for the identification of peptides"}
steps.section: Mass spectrometry for the identification of peptides
